alert.note: Alert for Mora; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 2:19PM MDT until September 01 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy rainfall from earlier slow-moving thunderstorms will lead to excessive runoff over some northern portions of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. Creek and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall over portions of the vulnerable burn scar is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Taos. In northeast New Mexico, Mora. This includes some northern portions of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire area, in particular the Vigil Canyon and upper Mora River area. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mora, Cleveland, Holman, La Cueva, Chacon and Golondrinas. - This includes the following highways... State Road 94 near Mile Marker 18. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 22 and 38. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 7. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 5.
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the northern Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
